workflow.name: Manage Notion to-do tasks via Telegram with voice messages & OpenAI
workflow.description:
# Your Own Personal Assistant

This workflow turns a Telegram bot into a simple Notion To-Do assistant.

Send a message in Telegram (text or voice). If it‚Äôs a voice message, the workflow downloads the audio and uses OpenAI to transcribe it into text. Then an AI agent (‚ÄúTard‚Äù) uses the latest message + a short memory of the recent chat to understand what you want and perform the right action in Notion (search your pages or create a new task/page in your To-Do list). The result is sent back to you in Telegram in a clean, readable format.

> Email and Calendar nodes are included for future expansion but are disabled by default. The assistant is designed to work with Notion only.

options.systemMessage:
=You are my personal assistant. Your name is Tard.

Today‚Äôs date is:
{{ $today.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }}

Scope of responsibility:
You work exclusively with Notion.

Your main focus:
Managing and reading a Todo List.

You work with pages, tasks, and data stored in Notion only.
You do NOT have access to email or calendars and must ignore them completely.

Notion guidelines:
- When presenting tasks, filter and show only what is relevant to the request
- If no date is specified, assume the user means today
- Be clear, short, and well structured
- Do not invent information that does not exist in Notion
- Always include a Notion link when answering questions about Notion content

General questions:
You may also answer general AI questions not related to Notion, such as:
- History
- Nutrition (e.g. calories in food)
- General knowledge
- Simple explanations of various topics

Behavior rules:
- Use a natural, informal tone
- Be helpful, focused, and not verbose

parameters.content:
## How it works

This workflow turns Telegram messages (text or voice) into actions in Notion.
Users can send a message to a Telegram bot, and the workflow will:
‚Ä¢ Convert voice messages to text using OpenAI
‚Ä¢ Keep short conversational context
‚Ä¢ Use an AI agent to read, search, and create tasks in Notion
‚Ä¢ Reply back to the user in Telegram with clear, formatted results

The assistant is focused on managing a Todo List in Notion.
It does not interact with email or calendars, even if nodes exist for future expansion.

## Telegram Input

Receives incoming Telegram messages.
Routes text vs. voice messages to the correct processing path.

## Voice to Text

Downloads Telegram voice messages and converts them into text using OpenAI.

## Conversation Memory

Stores recent messages so the assistant can stay on topic during short conversations.

## AI Assistant

Understands user requests and decides when to search or create tasks in Notion.
The agent is strictly focused on Todo management.

## Notion Integration

Creates and searches tasks and pages inside Notion based on the user request.

## Reply to User

Sends the assistant‚Äôs response back to Telegram in a clean, readable format.

## Optional Integrations

Gmail and Google Calendar nodes are disabled by default.
Enable and configure them only if you want to extend the workflow beyond Notion.

## Setup steps

1. Create a Telegram bot and connect it to the Telegram Trigger node
2. Add your OpenAI API key (used for voice transcription and the AI agent)
3. Connect your Notion account and update the Page/Database URL
4. (Optional) Enable Gmail or Google Calendar nodes if you plan to extend the workflow
5. Activate the workflow and start chatting with the bot

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
